answers.answer: I hope these answers your questions.By "sedrate" did you mean Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR); Sed rate; Sedimentation rate?Normal ResultsAdults (Westergren method):* Men under 50 years old: less than 15 mm/hr* Men over 50 years old: less than 20 mm/hr* Women under 50 years old: less than 20 mm/hr* Women over 50 years old: less than 30 mm/hrFasting Glucose (blood sugar)Normal ResultsLevels vary according to the laboratory, but in general up to 100 milligrams per deciliter (mg/dL) are considered normal.Talk to your doctor about the meaning of your specific test results.Persons with levels between 100 and 126 mg/dL may have impaired fasting glucose or pre-diabetes. These levels are considered to be risk factors for type 2 diabetes and its complications.Diabetes is typically diagnosed when fasting blood glucose levels are 126 mg/dL or higher.In medical terms, I don't know what a "rummy" is. Gin rummy I do.

question: I recently I had a physical and had fasting blod test along with a urine test. The nurse called back saying that I had elevated blood sugar and elevated sedrate (possible rhuematoid arth) I have been scheduled to see a rummy, and to have a 24 hr urine test..is this test for the arthritis or sugar?  both have reasons to have this test done..also why would the dr not do the 4 hour sugar fasting if my levels are high first?  Does anyone know what normal to high levels are in Sugar  or if anyone knows the levels of a sedrate test..on this I tested 54..I can't remember the blood sugar, but I will get that info Monday. Thanks for any info.
title: Dx and test
